fields: music & sound art
description:
Jam Discipline is a format of interaction between artists from diverse disciplines, gathered for collective creation. Each session is inviting artists to become a living laboratory: to improvise, meet each other, exchange ideas, and learn from each other in real time.

The focus is not on performance but on co-authoring. It’s a meeting point for communities that don’t usually meet.

fields: music & sound art, lighting, digital, design, visual art, theatre & performance
description:
Notations is an annual music laboratory where artists come together to reinterpret and transform Armenian classical music through interdisciplinary collaboration.

Participants will interact with archival Armenian compositions, combining them with contemporary sound techniques, performance, visual arts, and technology. The laboratory provides a space for creating new artistic expression that challenges traditional structures and expands the boundaries of audio-visual experience.

fields: music & sound art, lighting, media art
description:
Sarerits continues the collaboration with State Philharmonia of Armenia through curated sessions that showcases overlooked or emerging talent from the Armenian music scene.

Every edition features fully produced sets, shaped together with our curators and students from the educational program. It offers artists the chance to work in a professional environment and reach wider audiences. It’s both a stage and a training ground.

fields: art management
description:
A series of workshops on art management in theater and cinema.

This program supports young managers, producers, and cultural workers through short and long modules. Participants learn practical tools: distribution, grant writing, communication, budgeting, and project sustainability. The focus is on real cases and collaborative methods. It aims to form a new generation of arts managers who can work confidently both locally and internationally.

fields: music & sound art, lighting
description:
This is an intensive hybrid educational program in collaboration with State Philharmonia of Armenia that will bring emerging professionals from different regions of Armenia to study sound engineering and light engineering.

The teaching is built on real production processes, guided by both local mentors and international specialists. Participants work hands-on with equipment, concerts, and installations. The vision is to build long-term technical capacity for Armenia’s creative field.

fields: music & sound art
description:
SoundCrit is a public collective listening, guided by curators from hosq and beyond. It is open to music producers, music makers, and songwriters who want to develop their artistic ear and receive constructive, fair feedback on their work.

Instead of analyzing a work as a product or performance, the team of professionals will explore how we perceive it: how sound shapes time, space, and imagination. Artists submit an audio with a short context note, the works are anonymized and played in sequence, and listeners respond without knowing who created them.

fields: music & sound art, visual art, design
description: Urish is a label built to connect Armenia with the world through sound. It produces and releases collaborations between local artists and international creators. The label focuses on hybrid forms, cross-border dialogue, and long-term artistic relationships. Each release is treated as a cultural meeting, not just a product.
